task_description: Facing the building to your South (approx. 161°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: To see the full structure of the target building from ground to roof, I need to adjust the camera pitch upward to capture the upper portion of the building clearly.
My current heading is 0°N, but the target building is to the South (approx 161°), so I need to rotate right by 161 degrees to face the target building and continue observing its full structure.

I am now facing the target building, but need to look upward to see the full roof structure; rotating the camera pitch up by 30 degrees will allow me to capture the upper portion of the building, which is necessary for estimating the total height from ground to roof.

I am currently facing North, so I need to rotate right by 161 degrees to face the target building (approx. 161°S) while keeping the upward pitch to view its upper structure, which is essential for estimating the total height.

I am facing the target building, but my current pitch is 0° which only shows the lower part; I need to rotate the camera upward with a pitch of 30° to view the upper sections of the building, allowing me to see the full structure from ground to roof for an accurate height estimate.

I am currently facing North with an upward pitch; I need to rotate right by 161 degrees to face the target building (161°S) while maintaining the 30° upward pitch to view its full structure from ground to roof for height estimation.

I am facing the target building with a 0° pitch, so I need to rotate the camera upward by 45 degrees to view the upper sections and roof of the building, which will allow me to assess its full height from ground to roof.

I am facing North with a 45° upward pitch; I need to rotate right by 161 degrees to face the target building (161°S) while maintaining the 45° upward pitch to view its full structure for an accurate height estimate.

I am facing the target building, but my current 0° pitch only shows the lower portion; rotating the camera upward with a 30° pitch will let me view the upper sections and roof, enabling me to assess the full height from ground to roof.

To avoid losing the correct heading when adjusting pitch, I will perform a single rotation to set heading to 161°S (facing the target) and pitch to 30°UP to view the upper structure, allowing me to see the full building for height estimation.
I can now see the full structure of the target building from ground to roof; based on the visible number of floors (approximately 6, each ~3 meters), the estimated total height is 18 meters.
